title: Java Reflection API
subject: Java
theory:
Reflection allows inspection of classes, interfaces, fields and methods at runtime without knowing names at compile time.

*   **getClass()**: Entry point.
*   Can break Encapsulation (Accessing private fields).

common_mistakes.correction: Reflection is slower than direct calls. Use sparingly.

interview_questions.question: How to create object of a class known only by string name?

practice_problems.problem: Print all method names of String class.

real_world_use_cases.description: Eclipse/IntelliJ use reflection to show you autocomplete suggestions.

summary: Reflection is magic for frameworks, dangerous for apps.
